AFP_ENG_20090531.0001	0	58	Chile swine flu cases jump to 276 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0001	1	167	Chilean health authorities confirmed 26 new cases of swine flu on Sunday, raising the number of patients with A(H1N1) virus in the country to 276, the highest number on the continent. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0001	2	360	The sometimes-deadly disease continued its rise across Latin America meanwhile with Argentina, Brazil, Bolivia, Peru and the Dominican Republic all reporting new cases. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0001	3	538	Officials here said that most of the victims were in the capital, and that most cases were mild and being treated at home. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0001	4	661	Three people remain in serious condition in hospital, however. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0001	5	733	Swine flu has killed nearly a hundred and infected over 15,500 worldwide, according to World Health Organization (WHO) figures, since it emerged in North America in late April. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0001	6	919	According to figures released by individual governments, the virus has actually now killed more than 110 people around the world. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0001	7	1058	In the southern hemisphere, health experts fear the new virus could take hold, as winter sets in and the regular flu season gets underway. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0001	8	1206	Argentine health authorities meanwhile reported 15 new cases on Sunday, a day after reporting 20 new cases, raising the country's total patient count to 115. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0001	9	1373	Officials in Buenos Aires said those with new swine flu infections were recovering well and that most of them were found at several private schools in the capital, where students had recently returned from the United States. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0001	10	1607	The outbreak has prompted officials to close the schools for two weeks in a bid to contain the virus. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0001	11	1718	In the Dominican Republic officials confirmed nine cases of the disease, raising the country's total to 11, a day after Santo Domingo rebuffed a Russian claim that the Caribbean island was underreporting its cases in a bid to boost tourism. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0001	12	1968	"We fear that in reality, the situation is very different," Gennady Onishchenko, Russia's chief sanitary inspector, had told the Interfax news agency in response to the island reporting only two cases. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0001	13	2179	On Sunday the island's Ministry of Public Health reported that of the nine new cases one had been hospitalized. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0001	14	2300	In Peru health authorities said they had confirmed two more cases of the virus, bringing the country's total to 40. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0001	15	2425	Both cases were found in Lima and are recovering well on medication at home, officials said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0001	16	2527	Brazil also confirmed four new cases, which brought the country's total number to 20. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0001	17	2622	At its last count at the end of last week Mexican authorities said 97 people had died from the disease and that 4,932 had been infected. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0001	18	2759	Officials however maintained that the epidemic was on the wane there.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0014	1	200	World football's governing body has been notified that its policies are "totally in compliance" with those of the World Anti-Doping Agency, apart from the issue of reintegrating players after a suspension, FIFA president Joseph Blatter said Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0014	2	458	Blatter, speaking at the conclusion of FIFA executive committee meetings here, said WADA had confirmed that "FIFA's disciplinary code and FIFA's anti-doping code, is totally in compliance with the WADA code". 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0014	3	676	The lone exception, he said had to do with when suspended players can resume training with their clubs. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0014	4	789	FIFA secretary general Jerome Valcke said that FIFA's position is that a player suspended for 12 months should be allowed to resume training after nine months. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0014	5	958	FIFA and WADA had been at odds recently over WADA requirements on availablity of players for out-of-competition drugs testing. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0014	6	1094	Since the beginning of January, the world anti-doping code requires elite athletes to give notice of their location at a chosen one-hour period each day, seven days a week. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0014	7	1276	FIFA had contended that players should be subject to testing when with their teams, but not when on holiday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0014	8	1394	World anti-doping chief John Fahey said FIFA's stance "ignores the reality of doping in sport." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0014	9	1499	"There is no problem between the WADA organization and FIFA," Blatter said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0014	10	1584	"The only problem that we had, which has now been put away ... is the question, 'Is WADA a service organization for the world of sport?' 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0014	11	1721	The answer is yes. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0014	12	1740	WADA is not a police organization." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	0	58	Abortion doctor shot dead in Kansas church 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	1	183	Authorities here on Sunday arrested a suspect in the death of a controversial provider of late-term abortions, who was fatally shot as he walked into services at his Kansas church, officials said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	2	389	Abortion doctor George Tiller was shot to death just after 10:00 am (1500 GMT) in the lobby of Reformation Lutheran Church in Wichita, Kansas, police and city officials said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	3	573	President Barack Obama expressed outrage at the fatal shooting of the controversial doctor, in a statement released by the White House. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	4	718	"I am shocked and outraged by the murder of Dr George Tiller as he attended church services this morning," said Obama. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	5	846	"However profound our differences as Americans over difficult issues such as abortion, they cannot be resolved by heinous acts of violence." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	6	996	Wichita officials said the suspect, who was not identified, was arrested some three hours after the killing. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	7	1105	Local media identified the suspect as a 51-year- old man, who would be returned to Wichita to be charged. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	8	1220	"It's an unfortunate incident to happen on a Sunday morning," Wichita police captain Brent Allred told reporters. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	9	1334	"These things should not occur at a any time." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	10	1390	Long a lightning rod in the bitter US culture war over abortion, Tiller, 67, over the years had been picketed, bombed and shot in the arms, before being killed Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	11	1567	Tiller's was one of only three clinics in the United States that perform late- term abortions, which are performed on fetuses that would be viable outside the mother's womb. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	12	1750	Late-term abortions are legal in Kansas if two independent physicians agree that the mother could suffer irreparable harm by giving birth. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	13	1898	The shooting occurred just two weeks after Obama sought "common ground" over the divisive abortion debate in a controversial speech at one of the top Catholic universities in the United States. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	14	2101	President Obama has attempted to defuse one of the most emotive issues in US public life by arguing that while abortion should remain legal, the government should do all it can to limit unwanted pregnancies. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	15	2318	But Obama has angered the anti-abortion movement by reversing predecessor George W. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	16	2402	Bush's restrictions on federal funding for embryonic stem-cell research and for family-planning groups that carry out or facilitate abortions overseas. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	17	2563	Obama's choice for health secretary, former Kansas governor Kathleen Sebelius, has been widely condemned by the anti-abortion movement because of her ties to Tiller. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	18	2738	His family released a statement saying Tiller "dedicated his life to providing women with high-quality heath care despite frequent threats and violence," according to the local KWCH TV station. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	19	2941	"We ask that he be remembered as a good husband, father and grandfather and a dedicated servant on behalf of the rights of women everywhere." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	20	3092	Tiller had been demonized by abortion opponents who regularly protested outside his clinic. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	21	3193	In 1986, someone placed a bomb on the roof of the clinic, seriously damaging the building. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	22	3284	In 1993, Tiller was shot in both arms outside the clinic. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	23	3342	Tiller recovered, and his assailant received an 11-year prison term. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	24	3420	Some 2,000 protesters were also arrested outside the clinic during summer-long demonstrations in 1991. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	25	3532	He was acquitted in March on charges that he performed 19 illegal abortions in 2003 in a case which his lawyer described as a witch hunt.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	2	406	Monday will be a historic day for the US automobile industry, with  President Barack Obama poised to discuss General Motors' bankruptcy in remarks planned for 11:30 am (1530 GMT) Monday, after the auto giant officially files its bankruptcy paperwork, US media reported. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	3	685	Meanwhile, GM's new chief executive, Fritz Henderson, has scheduled a news conference for the middle of the day in New York, where the number one US automaker would file for bankruptcy. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	4	880	The developments came as creditors holding about 54 percent of General's Motors bonds approved a restructuring plan proposed by the US Treasury, a spokesman for the bondholders said Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	5	1079	The 54 percent represented 975 institutions, a spokesman for the ad hoc committee of bondholders, Elliot Sloane told AFP. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	6	1201	Washington had warned that if the plan were rejected, creditors risked losing everything. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	7	1300	The US administration had given GM until June 1 to present a viable restructuring plan, in return for government aid, and the US Treasury Department had given holders of General Motors until the end of the day Saturday to respond to the rescue plan. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	8	1559	Agreement boosted the Treasury's plan for creating a new company shorn of labor costs and money losing assets, in a rescue that could reach 60 billion dollars as the state takes a 72.5 per cent ownership stake in the 101 year old company. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	9	1807	Meanwhile Canada, which has several GM factories, is also set to be digging into its pockets for the rescue plan. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	10	1930	Among the backers was a committee of large investors holding about 20 percent of GM's 27.2 billion dollars in outstanding bonds, The New York Times reported. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	11	2097	Under the plan, the bondholders would obtain the rights to buy an extra 15 percent of GM's stock at a low price. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	12	2210	They would also control 25 percent of the new GM, after having supported the new company's creation in bankruptcy court. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	13	2340	Bondholders who rejected the plan could still fight it in court, but the government maintains they could end up with little or nothing if they take that path. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	14	2508	On Monday, New York bankruptcy judge Arthur Gonzales was set to rule on number three US automaker Chrysler, which filed for bankruptcy protection a month ago. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	15	2676	Under an expedited process, Gonzales was expected to approve the creation of a new Chrysler that would preserve the automaker's healthiest assets and liquidate the rest. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	16	2855	The new entity will be controlled by a consortium consisting of the Italian automaker Fiat, the United Auto Workers union, and the US and Canadian governments. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	17	3024	Fiat will have a 20 percent stake with the option to increase it to 35 percent; the UAW 55 percent; and the US and Canadian governments 10 percent. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	18	3181	The automakers' fate, the subject of debate on television talks shows, is being closely watched in US political and economic circles. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	19	3324	"This is a real sad day," said former Republican presidential contender Mitt Romney.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	24	3526	My heart bleeds for the people in Michigan and Detroit, for all these auto workers," he said on Fox News Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	25	3648	At the end of last year, GM had 244,000 employees around the world, about half of them in the United States. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	26	3766	Republican Mitch McConnell, the Senate minority leader, called the auto rescue plan "a big mistake," arguing that the government had done too much to keep GM and Chyrsler out of bankruptcy. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	27	3965	In an interview with CNN, he held up the example of Ford, the number two US automaker, as "an American company that hasn't taken government money and is still producing automobiles."

AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	0	58	New therapies to treat breast, lymph cancer: studies 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	1	194	New therapies developed following groundbreaking clinical trials appear to effectively target breast cancer and non-Hodgkin's lymphoma, according to research unveiled Sunday at a major cancer conference. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	2	407	The first therapy targeting the capacity of cancer cells to repair themselves shows promise in treating breast cancer, according to results of two small clinical trials. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	3	586	The new agent, especially adept at targeting cancers that are most difficult to cure, neutralizes an enzyme called PARP (poly-ADP-ribose-polymerase) and prevents it from playing its usual role in repairing the DNA of damaged cells. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	4	827	Like healthy cells, cancerous cells employ PARP to regenerate themselves after they have been damaged by chemo-therapy treatments. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	5	967	The studies examined whether breast cancers are more susceptible to chemotherapy when the PARP enzymes have been neutralized. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	6	1102	The first clinical trial was conducted with 116 women suffering from so-called triple negative breast cancer. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	7	1221	These involve fast-spreading tumors that account for 15 percent of the 170,000 annual cases worldwide of breast cancer. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	8	1350	Some of the cases were treated with chemotherapy and a PARP inhibitor called BSI-201 made by the firm BiPar Sciences, a US affiliate of the French-owned laboratory Sanofi-Aventis. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	9	1539	The rest of the group was treated only with chemotherapy. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	10	1606	After six months, about 62 percent of the patients treated with BSI-201 combined with chemotherapy showed a comparative clinical improvement of 21 percent over the control group, said Joyce O'Shaughnessy, of the Baylor-Charles Sammons cancer center in Dallas, Texas. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	11	1882	She presented the results of the study at a conference of the American Society of Clinical Oncology this weekend in Orlando, Florida. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	12	2025	The women treated with BSI-201 survived 9.2 months on average, including 6.9 months in which the cancer did not spread, compared to an average survival of 6.9 months and 3.3 months in which the cancer was in check for those who were treated solely with chemotherapy. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	13	2301	The second clinical study involved 54 women suffering from advanced breast cancer linked to the gene mutation BRCA1 or BRCA2. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	14	2427	They were treated with the PARP blocker Olaparib made by the Anglo-Swedish pharmaceutical AstraZenica. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	15	2530	There was no control group. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	16	2567	The test showed that 40 percent of the patients who took the drug experienced a reduction in their tumors, said Andrew Tutt, a cancer specialist at Kings College in London. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	17	2749	In another study presented here researchers examined a vaccine on patients over eight years that targeted follicular non-Hodgkin's lymphoma, a particularly aggressive form of lymphatic cancer. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	18	2951	The study found that patients who received the BiovaxID vaccine experienced on average disease-free survival of approximately 44 months, compared to about 30 months for patients who received a control vaccine -- an increase of 47 percent. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	19	3199	The BiovaxID vaccine is patient-specific, in that each dose must be individually manufactured from tissue obtained from a patient's own cancerous tumor. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	20	3361	"With this vaccine, we've now moved into an era where we can safely use a patient's immune system to effectively fight follicular lymphoma and enhance the response to conventional chemotherapy" said lead study author Stephen Schuster. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	21	3605	"Because this vaccine uniquely recruits the patient's immune system to seek and destroy only tumor B-cells, this approach may be applicable to the treatment of other B-cell lymphomas," Schuster added.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0031	1	178	Nigeria's army said Sunday it had destroyed a rebel camp in southern Rivers state as part of its campaign to end years of violence and kidnappings in the oil-rich region.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0031	6	990	Several camps operated by militants have been destroyed since May 13 when federal troops launched their operation against fighters of the Movement for the Emancipation of Niger Delta (MEND), Nigeria's main militant group. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0031	7	1221	But MEND said in a statement late Sunday there was no fresh attack on its camp at Buguma. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0031	8	1320	"The leader of a small group of fighters around the Buguma creek axis in Rivers state, Egbele has confirmed that there was no attack in his camp as claimed by the military JTF," the group said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0031	9	1523	"He (Egbele) said they actually asked him to cooperate by giving the impression his camp has been over-run," MEND added. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0031	10	1653	In the past three and a half years MEND, which says it is fighting to ensure local people have a greater share in the oil wealth, has been behind a series of kidnappings of staff and attacks on oil installations in the region. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0031	11	1889	Unrest in the Niger Delta has reduced Nigeria's daily output to 1.76 million barrels compared with 2.6 million barrels in January 2006. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0032	0	58	Abortion doctor shot dead at his Kansas church 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0032	1	187	Authorities here on Sunday arrested a suspect in the death of a controversial provider of late-term abortions, who was fatally shot as he walked into services at his Kansas church, officials said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0032	2	393	Abortion doctor George Tiller, was shot to death just after 10:00 am (1500 GMT) in the lobby of Reformation Lutheran Church in Wichita, Kansas, police and city officials said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0032	3	578	Wichita officials said the suspect, who was not identified, was arrested some three hours after the killing, and said they would have more details about the alleged shooter at a press conference planned for 4 pm local time (2100 GMT Sunday). 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0032	4	829	"It's an unfortunate incident to happen on a Sunday morning," Wichita police captain Brent Allred told reporters. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0032	5	952	"These things should not occur at a any time." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0032	6	1008	Long a lightning rod in the bitter US culture war over abortion, Tiller, 67, over the years had been picketed, bombed and shot in the arms, before being killed Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0032	7	1185	The shooting occurred just two weeks after President Barack Obama sought "common ground" over the divisive abortion debate in a controversial speech at one of the top Catholic universities in the United States. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0032	8	1405	The president has attempted to defuse one of the most emotive issues in US public life by arguing that while abortion should remain legal, the government should do all it can to limit unwanted pregnancies. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0032	9	1620	But Obama has angered the anti-abortion movement by reversing predecessor George W. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0032	10	1704	Bush's restrictions on federal funding for embryonic stem-cell research and for family-planning groups that carry out or facilitate abortions overseas. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0032	11	1865	Obama's choice for health secretary, former Kansas governor Kathleen Sebelius, has been widely condemned by the anti-abortion movement because of her ties to Tiller. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0032	12	2040	Tiller, one of the few doctors who still performs late-term abortions in the United States, has been demonized by abortion opponents who regularly protested outside his clinic. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0032	13	2226	In 1986, someone placed a bomb on the roof of the clinic, seriously damaging the building. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0032	14	2326	In 1993, Tiller was shot in both arms outside the clinic. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0032	15	2384	Tiller recovered, and his assailant received an 11-year prison term.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0032	17	2574	He was acquitted in March on charges that he performed 19 illegal abortions in 2003 in a case which his lawyer described as a witch hunt. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0032	18	2721	Tiller testified during the trial that he spent years under the protection of federal agents after the FBI discovered an anti-abortion assassination list in 1994 that listed Tiller as the top target. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0032	19	2930	Tiller also testified that he owns one of only three clinics in the United States that perform late-term abortions, which are performed on fetuses that would be viable outside the mother's womb.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0035	0	58	First president of Guinea-Bissau dies aged 78 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0035	1	177	Luis Cabral, the first post-independence president of Guinea-Bissau who was later toppled in a military coup, has died of a heart attack in Lisbon, officials announced on Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0035	2	356	He was 78. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0035	3	376	"It is with shock and sadness that the government and people of Guinea-Bissau have learnt of the loss of one of their most illustrious sons, Luis Cabral," the government announced in a statement. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0035	4	581	The government was to hold an emergency session to organise preparations for a three-day period of national mourning, the statement added. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0035	5	729	Natural Resources Minister Oscar Barbosa, a close ally of the former president, said that Cabral had died of a heart attack in the Portuguese capital on Saturday night. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0035	6	907	Cabral was a half-brother of Amilcar Cabral, long-time leader of the Independence of Guinea and Cape Verde (PAIGC) liberation movement, who was assassinated in 1973 -- the year before Guinea-Bissau attained its independence from Portugal. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0035	7	1155	Cabral ruled in Guinea-Bissau until he was overthrown in a coup led by "First Commissar", or prime minister, Joao Bernardo Vieira on November 14, 1980. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0035	8	1316	After his ouster, Cabral was imprisoned for six months before being released after the intervention of the Cuban government. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0035	9	1450	He then spent most of the rest of his life in exile in Portugal, although he did make a brief return to Guinea-Bissau 1999 after Vieira was toppled in another coup. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0035	10	1624	News of his death comes less than three months after Vieira, who returned to power in 2005 elections, was assassinated by soldiers in the hours after a bomb attack which claimed the life of the West African country's military chief. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	0	58	British PM says won't quit as poll predicts Euro election rout 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	1	194	British Prime Minister Gordon Brown insisted Sunday he would not quit despite a scandal over MPs expenses and dire poll ratings for his ruling Labour Party before crunch European and local elections. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	2	403	He said the expenses furore, which has shown how lawmakers claimed from the public purse for everything from moat cleaning to a duck island, was "appalling" and "offends everything that I believe in". 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	3	613	Every member of parliament would be forced to account for all their expenses from the last four years, he promised. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	4	738	Some 13 lawmakers from Labour and the main opposition Conservatives have said they will resign since the Daily Telegraph newspaper began publishing the leaked claims three weeks ago. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	5	930	A new Sunday Telegraph/ICM poll suggested the revelations would hit Brown hard at the European and local elections, in which Britons vote Thursday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	6	1087	It suggested Labour would come third in the elections for the European Parliament with just 17 percent, behind David Cameron's Conservatives and the smaller centrist Liberal Democrats. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	7	1281	Even more damagingly, it suggested Labour would also come third in a general election with just 22 percent of the vote -- the worst Brown's party has done in an opinion poll since 1987. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	8	1476	Some 54 percent of those polled thought Labour had been worst affected by the expenses scandal, compared to 13 percent for the Conservatives. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	9	1627	But Brown, who must call a general election by the middle of next year, dismissed suggestions he could step down to make way for a more popular leader. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	10	1788	"Things go up and down," he said in an interview with BBC television. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	11	1858	"We're going through the most difficult economic circumstances the country has faced. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	12	1953	"People are angry rightly because they are worried when they see taxpayers' money wasted on their MPs and they're finding it very difficult... in a difficult economic situation," he added, referring to Britain's recession. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	13	2185	He also said he wanted to introduce a "constitutional renewal" bill and was looking at reforms including the case for a written constitution, lowering the voting age to 16 and reform of the unelected upper chamber, the House of Lords. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	14	2429	Cameron, meanwhile, renewed his calls for a snap general election, telling the BBC the public wanted to "sit in judgement on MPs". 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	15	2569	Public anger over expenses is widespread and in a sermon Sunday, the leader of the Scottish Catholic church expressed concern at the "fall from grace" of many people in politics, saying "money (was) at the root of many difficulties". 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	16	2812	Cardinal Keith O'Brien called on "those in public service of whatever kind who have failed us to reclaim the high standards which we expect of them". 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	17	2971	Turnout at European elections in Britain is usually low, due partly to widespread Eurosceptic sentiment, and in 2004 turnout was just 38 percent. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	18	3126	This time, fringe parties such as the anti-EU UK Independence Party and the far- right British National Party are expected to benefit. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	19	3261	Commentators say the BNP could even win its first seat at the European Parliament. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	20	3353	An Economist magazine/YouGov poll last week found that only 31 percent of Britons think its membership of the European Union is a good thing, compared to 37 percent who think it is bad. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	21	3548	ICM interviewed 1,013 adults by telephone May 27-28 for the Sunday Telegraph poll, while YouGov questioned 2,322 adults in Britain May 22-26.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	0	58	Football: Betis relegated after Osasuna, Sporting heroics 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	1	189	Real Betis were relegated from the Spanish top-flight on a heart-breaking final Sunday of the season, drawing 1-1 at home to Valladolid while relegation rivals Osasuna and Sporting Gijon both won. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	2	395	Betis started a point above the drop zone knowing a win would keep them in the top tier but Sporting's 2-1 comeback win over Recreativo Huelva coupled with Osasuna's sensational 2-1 victory against nine-man Real Madrid saw them relegated with 42 points. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	3	658	Betis, who are based in the southern city of Seville, were last relegated in 2000 but immediately won promotion the following season and have been in the first division since 2001, finishing as high as fourth in 2005. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	4	885	"It is a sad day because once again the football gods weren't on our side," said Betis coach Jose Maria Nogues. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	5	997	"Betis now have to get back in the top division for its fans and history." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	6	1081	Getafe, who drew 1-1 with Racing Santander, also finished on 42 points but stayed up on goal difference while Valladolid's draw at Betis was enough to keep them safe. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	7	1257	It was particularly tough for Betis duo Sergio Garcia and Ricardo Oliveira, who cost a combined 19 million euros after being relegated with Real Zaragoza last season. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	8	1433	At half-time Sporting Gijon, trailing Recre 1-0, were set to be relegated but came back to win 2-1 and secure their top-flight status. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	9	1577	Sporting had spent a decade in the second division before winning promotion last season and defied the odds to stay up with Luis Moran scoring a dramatic winner. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	10	1748	"It was an agonising game that felt like seven days," said Sporting coach Manolo Preciado. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	11	1839	"Our fans are special and their contribution throughout this season has been pivotal." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	12	1935	Osasuna were third from bottom before kick off and fell behind against Real Madrid when Gonzalo Higuain scored early on. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	13	2065	However, Jose Camacho's men battled back, equalising through Jaroslav Plasil before Juanfran smashed a stunning volley past Iker Casillas to keep them in the division. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	14	2242	"We reached our target although it was a bit last minute," said Camacho. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	15	2315	"It is clear that Osasuna need to reconstruct the squad a bit because for the past two seasons we have been fighting for survival on the final weekends of the season." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	16	2492	Michel Salgado and Klaas-Jan Huntelaar were both sent off for Real, who crashed to a fifth successive defeat. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	17	2611	Earlier, Espanyol bid farewell to their Montjuic stadium in style with captain Raul Tamudo scoring a hat-trick in a 3-0 win over 10-man Malaga. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	18	2764	Tamudo, the club's all-time top-scorer and an icon after spending his entire career at Espanyol, scored twice in the first half and completed his treble with a 56th-minute penalty to give the Montjuic the perfect send-off. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	19	2996	Espanyol's new Cornella-El Prat stadium looked destined to host second-division football next season before the club produced a sensational late run to beat the drop. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	20	3172	With 26 games played Espanyol were bottom of the table, seven points from safety, but Argentine coach Mauricio Pochettino turned things around and a burst of form saw the club win eight out of their ten final games. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	21	3397	Malaga coach Antonio Tapia confirmed that he would not be in charge of the club next season, saying that the time was right to step down. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	22	3544	"I won't be coach next season," said Tapia. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	23	3588	"After an excellent season I think it is the ideal time for my family and I to end this chapter in my life." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	24	3706	Elsewhere, Sevilla defeated relegated Numancia 2-0 in a game with little at stake. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	25	3798	Sevilla already had a Champions League spot wrapped up before the game and coach Manolo Jimenez tested fringe players with next season in mind. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	26	3951	Jimenez was recently rewarded with a contract extension until 2010 after getting Sevilla into the Champions League by finishing third and now has the task of trying to close the gap on the top two of Barcelona and Real Madrid. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	27	4187	Numancia will prepare for life in the second division with the highlight of their campaign a 1-0 victory over treble-winners Barcelona in Soria on the opening day of the season.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	0	58	Golf: Frenchman Cevaer shocks field to win European Open 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	1	188	France's Christian Cevaer, ranked a lowly 449th in the world, shocked a strong field to win the European Open here on Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	2	323	After four rounds of golf that saw 45 changes of the lead, the 39-year-old Frenchman, who has failed to make the top-30 in his last 15 starts and whose only previous Tour victory was the 2004 Spanish Open, beat England's Steve Webster, Scot Gary Orr and Spaniard Alvaro Quiros by a shot. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	3	620	His winning total of 281, seven under par, was 13 strokes more than Ross Fisher took on the same London Club course last year - and his 74 was the highest last round by a winner all season. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	4	819	But while Webster and Quiros both became more victims of the 471-yard last when tied for the lead - both carved their drives into the crowd, with Quiros hitting spectators with his first and second shots - Cevaer kept his nerve. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	5	1057	During the week the par four played to an average of nearly 4.7, with 154 bogeys, 48 doubles and 26 sevens or worse, but Cevaer parred it the first two days, birdied it in the third round and finished with the par he needed.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	1	191	The party backing South Ossetia's leader Eduard Kokoity was on course Sunday to sweep legislative elections and tighten the grip of the strongman president on the Georgian rebel region. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	2	386	Initial results showed Yedinstvo (Unity) well ahead in the vote in the mountainous rebel region that was the subject of a war last year between Moscow and Tbilisi and is recognised as independent by Russia and Nicaragua alone. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	3	622	The elections were marked by a sidelining of the local opposition who accuse Kokoity of seeking a loyal parliamentary majority to push through an amendment allowing him to run again for office when his second term lapses in 2011. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	4	861	Based on an initial count of almost 61 percent of the vote, South Ossetia's central election commission said Unity had polled 48.04 percent while the People's Party, also largely uncritical of Kokoity, won 18.47 percent. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	5	1091	The Communists were second with 23.51 percent of the vote. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	6	1159	Final results were due at 0600 GMT on Monday with officials estimating the turnout at 80 percent. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	7	1266	Only four parties are competing for the 34 seats in the parliament and the central election commission barred the only two parties not loyal to Kokoity. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	8	1428	The name of Unity also bears more than a passing resemblance to Russia's ruling party Edinaya Rossiya (United Russia) and it even used pictures of United Russia party leader Boris Gryzlov on its campaign literature. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	9	1653	But Russia -- which outraged the West by recognising South Ossetia as independent in the wake of the August war with Georgia -- has said South Ossetia should not amend the existing term limits in its constitution. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	10	1876	Kokoity said it was too early to say whether he planned to run again to lead the region of 50,000 people although he did not rule out that possibility.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	19	2634	As the reconstruction in the province stalled this winter, the opposition also accuses the separatist leader and his circle of diverting lorries carrying construction material and humanitarian aid to traffic the goods in Russia. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	20	2872	But despite the slow pace of reconstruction in the republic many praise Kokoity for his leadership during the August conflict. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	21	3008	"Kokoity has done a lot for the people of South Ossetia, he's fought 20 years for this country," Angela Tedeyeva, a 32-year-old teacher, said as she cast her ballot.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	11	2030	They would also control 25 percent of the new GM, after having supported the new company's creation in bankruptcy court. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	12	2160	Bondholders who rejected the plan could still fight it in court, but the government maintains they could end up with little or nothing if they take that path.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	14	2502	Under an expedited process, Gonzales was expected to approve the creation of a new Chrysler that would preserve the automaker's healthiest assets and liquidate the rest. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	15	2681	The new entity will be controlled by a consortium consisting of the Italian automaker Fiat, the United Auto Workers union, and the US and Canadian governments. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	16	2850	Fiat will have a 20 percent stake with the option to increase it to 35 percent; the UAW 55 percent; and the US and Canadian governments 10 percent.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	0	58	Millvina Dean, last Titanic survivor, dies in England: reports 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	1	194	Millvina Dean, the last remaining survivor of the sinking of the Titanic in 1912, died in a care home in England on Sunday, media reports said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	2	338	She was 97. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	3	359	Elizabeth Gladys Dean, known to friends as Millvina, was only nine weeks old when the liner hit an iceberg in the Atlantic Ocean on the night of April 14, 1912, and sank killing 1,500 people. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	4	560	She survived after being bundled up in a sack and carried to safety. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	5	629	Her mother Georgette Eva and brother Bertram also made it, but her father, Bertram Frank, was among those who died. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	6	754	Dean died in a private nursing home near Ashurst in the southern English county of Hampshire, according to the BBC and Britain's domestic Press Association news agency. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	7	923	Staff there refused to comment late Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	8	976	Dean's family had boarded the Titanic at Southampton, heading for a new life in Kansas where her father hoped to open a tobacconist shop. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	9	1123	Born on February 12, 1912, Dean was the youngest passenger on board. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	10	1192	At the time, RMS Titanic was the most luxurious, most technically advanced and largest passenger liner in the world. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	11	1318	She was dubbed "unsinkable", but it took just two hours and 40 minutes for her to disappear into the icy waters of the Atlantic after striking an iceberg at 11:40 pm on April 14. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	12	1506	Dean was taken back to Southampton with her family after the disaster and did not find out that she had been on board until she was eight years old and her mother was planning to remarry. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	13	1703	According to enthusiasts' website Encyclopedia Titanica (ET), Dean worked for the government as a cartographer during World War II and then for an engineering company. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	14	1880	She told reporters that it was not until the wreckage of the liner was found in 1985 that she suddenly became a celebrity, taking part in documentaries and giving media interviews. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	15	2070	Dean was invited to complete her family's ill-fated journey to the United States in 1997 aboard the QE2, and accepted, although she turned down an offer to attend the premier of the movie "Titanic" because it would be too upsetting. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	16	2312	She moved into a private nursing home in Hampshire after breaking her hip three years ago, and after struggling to pay the bills was forced to sell off some of her memorabilia. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	17	2498	At auction in October 2008 she raised 31,150 pounds (40,000 euros, 53,900 dollars), selling off rare prints of the liner signed by the artists as well as compensation letters sent to her mother by the Titanic Relief Fund. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	18	2729	Dean was also forced to sell a 100-year-old suitcase filled with clothes donated to her family by the people of New York when they arrived after being rescued. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	19	2898	In the wake of the auction, friends including members of the British Titanic Society and the Belfast Titanic Society -- the liner was built in Belfast in Northern Ireland-- set up a campaign to secure her future. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	20	3120	Among the donors to the Millvina Fund were Hollywood actors Kate Winslet and Leonardo DiCaprio, who starred in the 1997 "Titanic" film. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	21	3256	The pair and the film's director, James Cameron, reportedly donated 30,000 US dollars in total. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	22	3361	The last remaining US survivor, Lillian Asplund, died in her home in May 2006 at the age of 99. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	23	3457	She was just five years old when the Titanic went down.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0054	1	184	Support for the European Union's Lisbon treaty is consolidating in recession-hit Ireland, according to a poll released Sunday, ahead of a second referendum likely to be held by October. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0054	2	379	The TNS mrbi poll for Monday's Irish Times found support has increased by two points to 54 percent on a similar survey a fortnight ago, while the percentage of "no" voters has fallen one point to 28 percent. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0054	3	596	Eighteen percent said they did not know, down one point. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0054	4	662	In a shock result in a referendum last June, 53.4 percent voted "no" and 46.6 percent voted "yes", sparking a major crisis in the European Union. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0054	5	817	Of the 27 EU nations, only Ireland is constitutionally bound to hold a referendum on the treaty, which is designed to improve decision-making in a greatly expanded bloc. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0054	6	987	It must be ratified by all member states. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0054	7	1038	Dublin is seeking a number of guarantees from Brussels, including on the right to make its own laws on tax, defence and abortion, before holding another vote, likely before the end of the October. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0054	8	1244	The Irish Times said the "yes" side has maintained a consistent and steadily growing lead in its three polls since the beginning of 2009, despite a collapse in support for the coalition government of Prime Minister Brian Cowen. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0054	9	1481	The former Celtic Tiger economy has been devastated by the financial crisis, and voters were asked if, in the light of the recession, they thought it was better to be part of the EU. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0054	10	1673	A substantial 81 percent thought it was (up two points), 10 percent thought it was not (no change) and nine percent had no opinion (down two). 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0054	11	1825	The pollsters interviewed 2,000 voters face-to-face between May 26 and 28.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0055	2	380	Partial results released several hours after polls closed at 7:00pm (1700 GMT) showed that the main opposition Social Democrats were set to retain power in the capital Zagreb as their candidate and incumbent mayor was re-elected.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0055	5	917	The polls gave some four million voters the right for the first time to directly elect mayors, county prefects and municipal heads, along with 21 county assemblies and more than 550 city and town councils. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0055	6	1132	Although a final figure was not yet available, turnout appeared to be low with the electoral commission saying that 26.53 percent of the electorate had voted by 1400 GMT. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0055	7	1312	On May 17, Prime Minister Ivo Sanader's ruling conservative Croatian Democratic Union (HDZ) was re-elected in most counties in the first round while the SDP asserted their control in major cities.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0055	10	1721	Local analysts said the vote confirmed that the SDP and left bloc dominate in more developed parts of Croatia as well as in cities, while the HDZ and right- wing parties are more popular in less developed and rural areas. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0055	11	1952	The HDZ, founded by late nationalist leader Franjo Tudjman, returned to power in 2003 after three years in opposition. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0055	12	2071	Sanader has since shaken off the HDZ's hardline nationalist legacy and transformed it into a party that is aiming to lead Croatia to becoming the European Union's 28th member by 2011.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	2	389	CNN reported Sunday that Obama will explain the rationale for the filing and his hopes that the bankruptcy filing offers the best hope for the company's turnaround. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	3	563	The president's administration had given GM until June 1 to present a viable restructuring plan, in return for government aid, and the US Treasury Department had given holders of General Motors until the end of the day Saturday to respond to the plan. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	4	824	The plan was approved by holders of about 54 percent of the company's bond debt according to Elliot Sloane, spokesman for an ad hoc bondholders committee. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	5	988	GM's new chief executive, Fritz Henderson, also has scheduled a news conference for midday Monday in New York. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	6	1108	General Motors got a boost Sunday as holders of more than half its bond debt agreed to a US Treasury rescue plan that would create a new company shorn of labor costs and money losing assets. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	7	1308	The rescue could reach 60 billion dollars with the state taking a 72.5 per cent ownership stake in the 101 year old company. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	8	1433	Canada, which has several GM factories, also will be digging into its pockets. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	9	1521	The new Treasury rescue plan would give bondholders up to 25 percent of the company. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	10	1606	Washington had warned that if the plan were rejected, creditors risked losing everything. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	11	1705	Among the backers was a committee of large investors holding about 20 percent of GM's 27.2 billion dollars in outstanding bonds, The New York Times reported. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	12	1872	Under the plan, the bondholders would obtain the rights to buy an extra 15 percent of GM's stock at a low price. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	13	1985	They would also control 25 percent of the new GM, after having supported the new company's creation in bankruptcy court. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	14	2115	Bondholders who rejected the plan could still fight it in bankruptcy court, but the government has warned they could end up with little or nothing if they take that path. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	15	2295	The New York bankruptcy court also is expected to rule Monday on number three US automaker Chrysler, which filed for bankruptcy protection a month ago. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	16	2456	Under an expedited process, judge Arthur Gonzales was expected to approve the creation of a new Chrysler, called 'New Carco,' which would preserve the automaker's healthiest assets and liquidate the rest. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	17	2670	The new entity will be controlled by a consortium consisting of the Italian automaker Fiat, the United Auto Workers union, and the US and Canadian governments. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	18	2839	Fiat will have a 20 percent stake with the option to increase it to 35 percent; the UAW 55 percent; and the US and Canadian governments 10 percent. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	19	2996	The automakers fate, the subject of debate on television talks shows, is being closely watched in US political and economic circles. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	20	3138	"This is a real sad day," said former Republican presidential contender Mitt Romney. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	21	3232	"I'm a son of Detroit. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	22	3255	My dad was an auto executive. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	23	3285	You know, I drive American cars. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	24	3318	I love American cars. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	25	3340	My heart bleeds for the people in Michigan and Detroit, for all these auto workers," he said on Fox News. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	26	3455	At the end of last year, GM had 244,000 employees around the world, about half of them in the United States. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	27	3573	Mitch McConnell, the senate minority leader, called the auto rescue plan "a big mistake," arguing that the government had done too much to keep GM and Chyrsler out of bankruptcy. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	28	3761	In an interview with CNN, he held up the example of Ford, the number two US automaker, as "an American company that hasn't taken government money and is still producing automobiles." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	29	3953	Corporate leaders, meanwhile, urged the government not to overstay its welcome in the private sector. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	30	4064	"I think all of us understand the need for the government to intervene and take the actions they did," said Anne Mulcahy, chief executive of Xerox. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	31	4212	"But I also think there's a need for an exit plan." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	32	4273	The possibility of bankruptcy for such an iconic American company has been viewed with great foreboding in a country where the automobile is deeply embedded in the national imagination. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	33	4468	"The phrase 'bankrupt General Motors,' which we expect to hear uttered on Monay, leaves Americans my age in economic shock," the writer PJ O'Rourke said in the Wall Street Journal. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0058	34	4649	"The words are as melodramatic as 'Mom's nude photos.'"

AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	0	58	South Ossetia poll set to bolster rebel leader 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	1	191	The party backing South Ossetia's leader Eduard Kokoity was on course Sunday to sweep legislative elections and tighten the grip of the strongman president on the Georgian rebel region. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	2	386	Initial results showed Yedinstvo (Unity) well ahead in the vote in the mountainous rebel region that was the subject of a war last year between Moscow and Tbilisi and is recognized as independent by Russia and Nicaragua alone. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	3	622	The elections were marked by a sidelining of the local opposition who accuse Kokoity of seeking a loyal parliamentary majority to push through an amendment allowing him to run again for office when his second term lapses in 2011. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	4	861	Based on an initial count of almost eight percent of the vote, South Ossetia's central election commission said Unity had polled 58.62 percent while the People's Party, also largely uncritical of Kokoity, won 20.35 percent. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	5	1094	The Communists were third with 14.6 percent of the vote. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	6	1151	Final results were due at 0600 GMT on Monday with officials estimating the turnout at 80 percent. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	7	1258	Only four parties are competing for the 34 seats in the parliament and the central election commission barred the only two parties not loyal to Kokoity. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	8	1420	The name of Unity also bears more that a passing resemblance to Russia's ruling party Edinaya Rossiya (United Russia) and it even used pictures of United Russia party leader Boris Gryzlov on its campaign literature. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	9	1645	But Russia -- which outraged the West by recognising South Ossetia as independent in the wake of the August war with Georgia -- has said South Ossetia should not amend the existing term limits in its constitution. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	10	1868	Kokoity said it was too early to say whether he planned to run again to lead the region of 50,000 people although he did not rule out that possibility. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	11	2029	"There are two and half years left till then and a lot left to do. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	12	2096	We are working and working now. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	13	2128	I am not thinking about it yet," he said in an interview with AFP. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	14	2204	"With what happened in August we need three to four years to rebuild," Kokoity said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	15	2298	Opposition activities said voting would not make a difference. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	16	2361	"I plan to sit at home. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	17	2385	There's nothing we can do," said Alan Gassiyev, an opposition leader, calling the polls "completely illegal."

AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	21	3000	"Kokoity has done a lot for the people of South Ossetia, he's fought 20 years for this country," Angela Tedeyeva, a 32-year-old teacher, said as she cast her ballot.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	23	3373	But Kokoity insisted the elections were in strict accordance with law, saying the polls were "a maturity test for the small independent state."

AFP_ENG_20090531.0065	1	193	Pakistan's defence secretary said Sunday that a month-long offensive to crush Taliban fighters in northwest Swat could end within days, as fierce fighting spilled into a nearby tribal area. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0065	2	392	Swat valley's main town Mingora is back in government hands, the military announced late Saturday, and security officials said they were now pursuing the top leadership of the hardline Taliban movement into the nearby mountains.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0074	2	395	Betis started a point above the drop zone knowing a win would keep them in the top tier but Sporting's 2-1 comeback win over Recreativo Huelva coupled with Osasuna's sensational 2-1 victory against nine-man Real Madrid saw them relegated with 42 points. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0074	3	658	Betis, who are based in the southern city of Seville, were last relegated in 2000 but immediately won promotion the following season and have been in the first division since 2001, finishing as high as fourth in 2005.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	0	58	Last Titanic survivor dies in England: BBC 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	1	174	Millvina Dean, the last remaining survivor of the sinking of the Titanic, died Sunday at a care home in England, the BBC reported, citing two of her friends. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	2	332	She was 97. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	3	353	Dean was a two-month-old baby and her family were emigrating to Kansas in the United States when the Titanic sank after hitting an iceberg in the Atlantic Ocean on its maiden voyage in 1912. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	4	553	She was placed in a sack and carried to safety. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	5	601	Her mother and brother also survived, but her father was among the 1,500 passengers and crew who died. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	6	713	Two of Dean's unnamed friends told the BBC that she died at the care home in Hampshire, in southern England. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	7	822	She had spent most of her life in Southampton in the county of Hampton, from where the Titanic set out. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	8	935	Dean had been struggling to pay the bills for her care home and in October 2008 raised 31,150 pounds (40,000 euros, 53,900 dollars) by auctioning off items from the liner. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	9	1116	She was forced to sell a 100-year-old suitcase filled with clothes which was donated to her family by the people of New York when they arrived in the United States after being rescued. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	10	1310	Rare prints of the liner signed by the artists along with compensation letters sent to her mother by the Titanic Relief Fund also went under the hammer in Devizes, southwest England. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	11	1502	The last remaining US survivor, Lillian Asplund, died in her home in May 2006 at the age of 99. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	12	1598	She was just five years old when the Titanic went down.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0079	0	58	Football: Sad exit for Jose as Ahly stunned in Angola 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0079	1	191	Manuel Jose ended his title-strewn career as Al-Ahly coach disastrously when the Egyptian giants were dumped out of the African Confederation Cup by Santos in Angola on Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0079	2	377	Ahly, winners of the African Champions League a record six times, took a 3-0 lead into the return match and even the absence of star midfielder Mohamed Aboutraika was not expected to prevent them reaching the group phase.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0079	14	2456	Ahly have campaigned in Africa regularly since 1975 and this was only the fourth time they had suffered a three-goal loss, with Mouloudia Alger of Algeria, Hearts of Oak of Ghana and Al-Hilal of Sudan inflicting the other defeats. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0079	15	2696	The heavy reverses against Mouloudia and Hearts came three decades ago while Hilal triumphed two years ago in Omdurman against a club that claims 40 million supporters in Egypt and the Middle East.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0082	1	187	Russian rider Denis Menchov won the Tour of Italy here on Sunday despite suffering a dramatic fall in the last kilometre of the final stage, a 14.4km time-trial round. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0082	2	364	The Rabobank cyclist, who is the third Russian to win the race, added the title to his two Tour of Spain victories in 2005 and 2007. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0082	3	506	The 31-year-old beat Italian 2007 champion Danilo Di Luca into second at 41sec with his compatriot Franco Pellizzoti rounding off the podium finishers a further 1min 18sec adrift. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0082	4	695	Lithuanian Ignatas Konovalovas of the Cervelo team won the final stage in a time of 18:42 with Briton Bradley Wiggins only a second back and Norway's Edvald Boasson Hagen in third.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0082	18	1817	Di Luca briefly looked to be on the brink of a famous victory when he got to the first time-check fastest of all and 5sec up on Menchov. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0082	19	1963	But the LPR rider had blasted out too fast, gradually fading from there and he was 14sec down on Menchov at the next time check. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0082	20	2101	When he came over the line, Di Luca had lost 45sec to Konovalovas whereas Menchov, who had won the 12th stage time-trial to take over the pink jersey last Thursday, was getting stronger. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0082	21	2297	The Russian looked like he may even win the final time-trial as well but with rain spitting down drama unfolded in the final kilometre. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0082	22	2442	Riding in a straight line but on a cobbled section, Menchov suddenly crashed with just 1km left to ride, but quick thinking from his mechanic may have secured him the victory. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0082	23	2627	As Menchov was still sliding along the wet surface, his mechanic had already jumped out of the team car and was unloading another bike from the roof. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0082	24	2786	Menchov went to pick up his splayed bike but received a shout from the mechanic and instead jumped straight onto the new one and was back on his way, courtesy of a push from the mechanic as well. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0082	25	2991	He had been going so well, though, that he still had time to spare on Di Luca and despite the crash he gained a further 21sec on his rival.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0082	31	3495	It's been a really tough course."

AFP_ENG_20090531.0090	0	58	GM: 54 percent of bondholders approve Treasury plan 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0090	1	187	Creditors holding about 54 percent of General's Motors bonds have approved a restructuring plan proposed by the US Treasury, a spokesman for the bondholders said Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0090	2	366	The 54 percent represented 975 institutions, a spokesman for the ad hoc committee of bondholders, Elliot Sloane told AFP. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0090	3	497	The Treasury had given the bondholders until the end of the day Saturday to respond to its proposal to create a new company and shed assets that were causing losses. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0090	4	672	The creditors collectively would receive 10 percent of GM's stock in return for their shares, and warrants, or options to buy stock, allowing them to acquire up to an additional 15 percent of the company's stock. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0090	5	894	If the options are exercised, they would control up to 25 percent of the "new GM," while the Treasury would at least initially hold a 72.5 percent stake in the company that emerges from a bankruptcy court reorganization. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0090	6	1124	Bondholders who rejected the plan account for about 46 percent of GM's bond debt. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0090	7	1206	They can contest it in court and try to get as much of what they are owed as they can through the bankruptcy proceedings. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0090	8	1337	The government has warned that they may end up with little or nothing if they take that route. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0090	9	1441	Once the world's biggest auto company, General Motors was poised Sunday to file for bankruptcy protection.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0113	2	399	Monday will be a historic day for the US automobile industry. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0113	3	461	GM's new chief executive, Fritz Henderson, has scheduled a news conference for the middle of the day in New York, where the number one US automaker would file for bankruptcy. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0113	4	645	The administration of President Barack Obama has given GM until June 1 to present a viable restructuring plan, in return for government aid. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0113	5	795	The rescue could reach 60 billion dollars with the state taking a 72.5 per cent ownership stake in the 101 year old company. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0113	6	920	Canada, which has several GM factories, also will be digging into its pockets. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0113	7	1008	According to The New York Times, holders of GM's secured bonds agreed by a small majority on Saturday to a new Treasury rescue plan that would give them 25 percent of the company. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0113	8	1188	Washington had warned that if the plan were rejected, creditors risked losing everything. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0113	9	1287	Among the backers was a committee of large investors holding about 20 percent of GM's 27.2 billion dollars in outstanding bonds, The Times said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0113	10	1441	No official announcement of the vote tally has yet been made. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0113	11	1512	Under the plan, the bondholders would obtain the rights to buy an extra 15 percent of GM's stock at a low price. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0113	12	1625	They would also control 25 percent of the new GM, after having supported the new company's creation in bankruptcy court. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0113	13	1755	The New York bankruptcy court also is expected to rule Monday on number three US automaker Chrysler, which filed for bankruptcy protection a month ago. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0113	14	1916	Under an expedited process, judge Arthur Gonzales was expected to approve the creation of a new Chrysler, called 'New Carco,' which would preserve the automaker's healthiest assets and liquidate the rest. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0113	15	2130	The new entity will be controlled by a consortium consisting of the Italian automaker Fiat, the United Auto Workers union, and the US and Canadian governments. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0113	16	2299	Fiat will have a 20 percent stake with the option to increase it to 35 percent; the UAW 55 percent; and the US and Canadian governments 10 percent. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0113	17	2456	The automakers fate, the subject of debate on television talks shows, is being closely watched in US political and economic circles.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0113	24	2915	At the end of last year, GM had 244,000 employees around the world, about half of them in the United States.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0115	8	1456	When a second liquefying unit becomes operational towards the end of the year Yemen will be able to export 6.7 million tonnes of gas annually -- equivalent to 180,000 barrels of oil per day (bpd).

AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	0	58	French physicists claim breakthrough in ultra-fast data access 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	1	193	French physicists said on Sunday they had used ultra-fast lasers that could accelerate storage and retrieval of data on hard discs by up to 100,000 times, pointing the way to a new generation of IT wizardry. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	2	410	The research builds on achievements that earned the 2007 Nobel physics prize for Albert Fert of France and Peter Gruenberg of Germany, who ushered in a revolution in miniaturised storage in the 1990s. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	3	620	Fert and Gruenberg discovered that tiny changes in magnetic fields can yield a large electric output. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	4	731	These differences in turn cause changes in the current in the readout head that scans a hard disk to spot the ones and zeroes in which data is stored. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	5	891	That discovery opened the way to "spintronics", a form of electronics that uses not only electrical charge but also the spin of electrons in individual atoms to provide a more compact, denser storage on hard drives. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	6	1116	But reading and writing data through spintronics has been hampered by the relative slowness of magnetic sensors. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	7	1238	In a study published in the specialist journal Nature Physics, a team led by Jean-Yves Bigot of the Institute of Materials Physics and Chemistry in Strasbourg employed a "femtosecond" laser, using ultra-fast bursts of laser light, to alter electron spin and thus speed up retrieval and storage. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	8	1542	"Our method is called the photonics of spin, because it is photons [particles of light] that modify the state of the electrons' magnetisation" on the storage surface, Bigot told AFP. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	9	1734	Data is retrieved with a burst that lasts just a millionth of a billionth of a second, said Bigot. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	10	1842	Femtosecond lasers currently measure around 30 centimetres (12 inches) by 10 centimetres (four inches) which means they are too big for consumer electronics, he cautioned. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	11	2023	Bigot added, though, that their miniaturisation is likely to be achieved over the next decade. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	12	2127	IBM, Hitachi and other corporations are "extremely interested" by the research, Bigot said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	0	58	First genes spotted for testicular cancer 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	1	172	Scientists in Britain said Sunday they had found the first genes that are associated with testicular cancer, the commonest form of cancer for men between the ages of 15 and 45. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	2	358	Telltale variants in chromosomes 5, 6 and 12 are linked with an increased risk of the disease, according to their study, which compared the genetic code of 730 men who had testicular cancer with that of healthy men. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	3	583	Inheriting the basket of three factors boosts the risk of the cancer, called testicular gem cell tumour, by up to fourfold. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	4	716	The study is published online in the journal Nature Genetics. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	5	787	"We have known for some time that men whose father, brothers or sons had testicular cancer are much more likely to get it themselves and we have been searching for this genetic link," said one of the investigators, Elizabeth Rapley of the Institute of Cancer Research, in the southern English county of Surrey. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	6	1107	"We believe there are more (risk factors) still to be found and we are working on identifying the rest." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	7	1221	The three telltales lie near genes that nurture testicular cells which are precursors in sperm development. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	8	1338	Worldwide incidence of testicular cancer is 7.5 cases per 100,000 men, but the rates vary remarkably between countries and according to ancestry, the ICR said in a press release. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	9	1526	Why this is so is unclear. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	10	1553	Inheritance, though, is a well-known risk factor and seems to be far higher than for other cancer types. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	11	1667	Studies have found that the risk to brothers of testicular cancer patients is eight to 10 times higher than the general population, while for fathers of patients, the risk is four to six times higher. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	12	1877	Testicular cancer is 99 percent curable if caught in its early stages, the ICR said.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	1	195	Rafael Nadal's hopes of a record fifth successive French Open title were crushed into the Roland Garros red dust by Robin Soderling's Swedish sledgehammer on Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	2	370	In one of the greatest upsets in the history of the tournament, the Spanish king of clay slumped to a first ever defeat here having racked up 31 wins in 31 outings since his 2005 debut. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	3	565	Soderling's stunning 6-2, 6-7 (2/7), 6-4, 7-6 (7/2) fourth round victory came just a month after he'd won only one game in a 6-1, 6-0 rout at the Rome Masters, his third defeat in three matches against the world number one. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	4	798	But he was a man transformed on Sunday with the 24-year-old unleashing a formidable service game and a relentless, pinpoint accurate forehand which forced Nadal to constantly scramble for a foothold in the match. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	5	1020	"He didn't surprise me because I know how he plays and how dangerous he can be," said Nadal who had won the Monte Carlo, Rome and Barcelona events in the run-up to Roland Garros.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	14	1653	"I'm so proud of myself. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	15	1678	This is the best win of my career against a man who is the greatest claycourt player in history." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	16	1785	Nadal's first set loss was the first time he had dropped a set in the tournament since the 2007 final against Roger Federer, ending a run of 32 in a row. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	17	1948	The Spaniard was reeling from the outset at the hands of a man whom he'd accused of being one of the most unpopular players in the locker room after an acrimonious Wimbledon clash two years ago. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	18	2152	Nadal was broken in the fourth game as 23rd seeded Soderling went to 4-1 ahead and again in the crucial eighth as the free-flowing, uninhibited Swede continued to find the corners with devastating accuracy. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	19	2368	The 24-year-old deservedly claimed the opening set when the champion netted a backhand. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	20	2465	Nadal, despite missing his usual fluency and rattled by the unrelenting assault, broke for the first time to lead 2-1 in the second set only to surrender his advantage in the 10th game. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	21	2660	With most people inside Court Philippe Chatrier expecting a Nadal drive to fly past the big Swede, Soderling executed a fine backhand volley to go to 5-5. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	22	2824	Despite those heroics, Nadal ran away with the tiebreaker to level the match when, for once, Soderling's forehand missed its target and flew long. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	23	2980	The Swede, coached by compatriot and 2000 finalist Magnus Norman, refused to yield, breaking to lead 4-3 before backing it up for a 5-3 advantage in the third set. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	24	3153	He took the set when Nadal netted another weary forehand off yet another deep Soderling drive. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	25	3257	Nadal broke to lead 2-0 in the fourth set, but Soderling hit back immediately as another tiebreak loomed where the gallant Swede clinched his famous win on a second match point when Nadal went wide with a pick-up. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	26	3480	Soderling sent down nine aces in the match and fired a decisive 61 winners to the Spaniard's 33. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	27	3586	His reward is a match-up with either Russian 10th seed Nikolay Davydenko or Fernando Verdasco, the eighth-seeded Spaniard for a place in the semi-finals. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	28	3749	Sunday's drama would have delighted Roger Federer, who has lost the last three finals to Nadal, and who still needs a French Open to complete a career Grand Slam. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	29	3921	He plays his last 16 tie on Monday against Germany's Tommy Haas.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	0	58	Motorcycling: Stoner ends Rossi's seven year reign at Mugello 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	1	203	Casey Stoner held off the fast-finishing Jorge Lorenzo to win the Italian Grand Prix on Sunday and bring to an end Valentino Rossi's seven-year reign here. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	2	368	The Australian also took over the lead in the world championship standings with his second win of the season having also triumphed in Qatar in the opening race of the season. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	3	552	He now leads Lorenzo, who started on pole here, by four points in the championship standings with Rossi third, a further five points back. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	4	700	In a dramatic race that began in wet conditions, Stoner seized the advantage when switching bikes after 10 laps for a change of tyres. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	5	844	"Once I got onto the slicks I found a good feeling immediately and I was able to get to the front quite quickly, but then I started having a problem with the clutch," he said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	6	1029	"It was a really hard race and I just wanted to finish it. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	7	1088	I just tried to stay smooth and keep the same lap times even if I couldn’t ride the way I wanted to." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	8	1199	He was the fastest man on the track by some margin in those first few laps after the switch and although Yamaha pair Lorenzo and Rossi were quickest at the end, they had both lost too much time and too many places to hit back. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	9	1435	Rossi blamed his team for making the wrong choice of tyre in the dry, going for the harder compound. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	10	1545	"It's a precious result, it's also nice to be on the podium. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	11	1606	The race was really difficult, we knew the weather would be terrible," he said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	12	1695	"In the dry we made a mistake in going with the hard tyres. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	13	1755	The choice of hards was made even though I wanted the soft ones." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	14	1830	Lorenzo said he was delighted with his finish having slid off on the warm-up lap and skidded at the start. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	15	1946	"Honestly, this is as good as a win for me and I can't really believe the race today, it was like a movie," he said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	16	2072	"It's a really amazing result because things could have been much worse today, so thank you again to everyone for making it possible. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	17	2206	I'm really happy with this result." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	18	2251	Stoner completed the 23 laps in 45min 41.894sec to beat Lorenzo by just over a second. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	19	2347	In an exciting race the pole-sitter got off to a terrible start in the wet and immediately dropped to eighth. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	20	2466	Quickest off the mark were Australian Chris Vermeulen, who started 11th, and Andrea Dovizioso, who began seventh but Stoner passed them both on the long straight at the beginning of the second lap. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	21	2673	Vermeulen quickly started heading backwards, eventually finishing 10th, as Rossi started to move up from fifth. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	22	2794	However Italian Marco Melandri on a Kawasaki, who started 15th on the grid, was clearly fastest in the wet. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	23	2911	Rossi took the lead from Dovizioso, who had got back past Stoner, on the seventh lap and two laps later he lost that to Melandri. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	24	3050	However, on the 10th lap all the front runners came into the pits for a change of bikes and when they came out, Stoner was quickest to find his pace. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	25	3209	Melandri immediately started heading backwards, eventually finishing 11th and 35sec back, while Loris Capirossi propelled himself into race contention with Stoner and Dovizioso. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	26	3396	Lorenzo and Rossi initially struggled with their bikes down in fifth and sixth and the time they lost over those first three laps coming out of the pits essentially cost either of them a chance of victory. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	27	3611	While Stoner had soon taken the race lead, both Yamaha riders had to then pass Melandri, Capirossi and Dovizioso and by the time they had done so, Stoner was over a second ahead and with only a couple of laps remaining. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	28	3840	Meanwhile former Superbikes champion James Toseland of Britain got his best finish of the season in seventh, benefitting from being the first man into the pits to change his bike. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	29	4029	It meant that his tyres were warm and he was flying as the fastest man on track for a few laps when everyone else was simply trying to get temperature into their new tyres.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0143	1	195	A controversial provider of late-term abortions was shot to death Sunday as he walked into services at his Kansas church, local media reports. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0143	2	347	A lightning rod in the bitter culture war over abortion, George Tiller has been picketed, bombed and shot in the arms. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0143	3	475	He was shot to death just after 10 am (1500 GMT) as he walked into Reformation Lutheran Church in Wichita, Kansas, the Wichita Eagle reported. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0143	4	627	Police contacted by AFP could not immediately confirm the report but said details of an incident at the church would be released later in the day. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0143	5	783	Tiller, 67, one of the few doctors who still performs late-term abortions in the United States, has been demonized by abortion opponents who regularly protest outside his clinic, located just off a busy highway that runs through Wichita. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0143	6	1030	In 1986, someone placed a bomb on the roof of the clinic, seriously damaging the building. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0143	7	1130	In 1993, Tiller was shot in both arms outside the clinic. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0143	8	1188	Tiller recovered, and his assailant received an 11-year prison term. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0143	9	1266	Some 2,000 protesters were also arrested outside the clinic during summer-long demonstrations in 1991. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0143	10	1378	He was acquitted in March on charges that he performed 19 illegal abortions in 2003.
